text: The Bryan Bombers were a Class-C minor league baseball team based in Bryan, Texas that played in the Lone Star League (1947–1948) and East Texas League (1949).BR Minors page Major league players Jo-Jo Moore, Stan Goletz, Jesse Landrum and Mel Deutsch played for the team. Goletz and Landrum also managed it. In 1953, the Greenville Majors of the Class B Big State League, moved to Bryan on June 25, 1953 and finished the 1953 season as the Bryan Majors. Renamed the Bryan Indians in 1954, Bryan moved to Del Rio, Texas on July 28, 1954 and finished the 1954 season as the Del Rio Indians. The team was 17-24 at the time of the move. They finished 53-93. The franchise folded after the season.https://www.baseball- reference.com/bullpen/Del_Rio_Indianshttps://www.baseball- reference.com/bullpen/Bryan_Indianshttps://www.baseball- reference.com/bullpen/Bryan_Majors The Bombers played their home games at Travis Field. ==References== Category:Baseball teams established in 1947 Category:Defunct minor league baseball teams Category:Baseball teams disestablished in 1949 Category:1947 establishments in Texas Category:1949 disestablishments in Texas Category:Defunct baseball teams in Texas Category:Bryan, Texas Category:Defunct Big State League teams
title: Bryan Bombers
